channel.title: Are webclients allowed?
channel.description:
I was wondering if i should make a webclient, I would really like a webclient because webclients generally have more players. What i am trying to get down to here is can jagex shut down a webclient? Im trying to decide because I would like my server to stick around for a very long time.
No need for rude posts..... ;)

item.title: Are webclients allowed?
item.dc:creator: @rain1994 rain1994
item.description:
@rain1994 wrote:

I just want to say i thank you guys for all the imput you have givin me its been very helpfull to me

Read full topic

item.title: Are webclients allowed?
item.dc:creator: @RunesGAYpe RunesGAYpe
item.description:
@RunesGAYpe wrote:

[quote=“Bromann, post:6, topic:347637”]Well legality isn’t black and white.

If you’re not making large amounts of profit, no company is going to go through the trouble of suing you.

There is ONE (1) case I know of a private server being sued in the history of all private servers for all video games, and that’s WoWScape… and that’s because they were earning anywhere between $100,00 and $500,000 a month, which the admin was spending on personal items. In addition they were conducting in-game micro-transactions that weren’t donations.

Also bnetd.

In both cases the people were stupid enough to go against a giant with enough lawyers to win any case. (The WoWGlider case was flimsy as hell and the judge wasn’t tech-savvy so they won it easily)

If you fuck with those big companies you will get dropped.

If you get that DMCA notice, shut your shit down and pack your bags up.

They’ll tell you to cease operations before they ever sue you, thankfully.[/quote]
True, but still, whats the chances? lol
if you dont claim it as your own you will be pretty safe i think.
but to answer your question; yes, they are.

Read full topic

item.title: Are webclients allowed?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Bromann, post:6, topic:347637”]Well legality isn’t black and white.

If you’re not making large amounts of profit, no company is going to go through the trouble of suing you.

There is ONE (1) case I know of a private server being sued in the history of all private servers for all video games, and that’s WoWScape… and that’s because they were earning anywhere between $100,00 and $500,000 a month, which the admin was spending on personal items. In addition they were conducting in-game micro-transactions that weren’t donations.

Also bnetd.

In both cases the people were stupid enough to go against a giant with enough lawyers to win any case. (The WoWGlider case was flimsy as hell and the judge wasn’t tech-savvy so they won it easily)

If you fuck with those big companies you will get dropped.

If you get that DMCA notice, shut your shit down and pack your bags up.

They’ll tell you to cease operations before they ever sue you, thankfully.[/quote]

This. On a side note, the server you code is not illegal as it isnt property of jagex so youre safe with it. On the other hand, the cache is illegal but you are very unlikely to be in any danger unless your server gets really big and you are making lots of money.

Read full topic

item.title: Are webclients allowed?
item.dc:creator: @Bromann Bromann
item.description:
@Bromann wrote:

Well legality isn’t black and white.

If you’re not making large amounts of profit, no company is going to go through the trouble of suing you.

There is ONE (1) case I know of a private server being sued in the history of all private servers for all video games, and that’s WoWScape… and that’s because they were earning anywhere between $100,00 and $500,000 a month, which the admin was spending on personal items. In addition they were conducting in-game micro-transactions that weren’t donations.

Also bnetd.

In both cases the people were stupid enough to go against a giant with enough lawyers to win any case. (The WoWGlider case was flimsy as hell and the judge wasn’t tech-savvy so they won it easily)

If you fuck with those big companies you will get dropped.

If you get that DMCA notice, shut your shit down and pack your bags up.

They’ll tell you to cease operations before they ever sue you, thankfully.

Read full topic

@RunesGAYpe wrote:

YES THEY ARE

Have you looked around? lol
theres nothing illigal about moparscape. if you were to make an exact duplicate of runescape and name it RunesGAYpe, they cant do shitt. go to the grocery store and look how many generic brands there are that are the same EXACT thing with another name.
Just dont name it runescape and claim that you are jagex and your straight bro

item.title: Are webclients allowed?
item.dc:creator: @raulhenriq raulhenriq
item.description:
@raulhenriq wrote:

they are not allowed, because all the models (or a big part of then) are from runescape, i mean, they are from the original runescape and we “steal” then. So you can not use then legally with out an kind of authorization from jagex, which you won’t get.

Read full topic
